ccre.ctrl

Class MultipleSourceBooleanController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.ctrl.MultipleSourceBooleanController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BooleanInput, BooleanInputPoll, BooleanInputProducer, EventConsumer

    public class MultipleSourceBooleanController
extends java.lang.Object
implements BooleanInput, EventConsumer
    A controller that combines a series of registered BooleanOutputs or BooleanInputs to create a single output or input line. This is a BooleanInput representing the current value, and an EventConsumer such that once the event is fired, the output will be correct.

      • OR

        public static final boolean OR

        Constant Field Values

      • ipl

        protected final CArrayList<BooleanInputPoll> ipl
        The list of polled inputs that are read during the update method.

      • bcur

        protected final CArrayList<java.lang.Boolean> bcur
        The list of current values for the asynchronously-updated inputs. Any elements in this list MUST be either Boolean.TRUE or Boolean.FALSE! Even the result of new Boolean(true) is not allowed!

      • consumers

        protected final CArrayList<BooleanOutput> consumers
        The list of consumers to be notified when the value changes.

      • lastValue

        protected boolean lastValue
        The current value of the result.

      • isAnd

        protected final boolean isAnd
        If the operation is an AND operation as opposed to an OR operation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultipleSourceBooleanController

        public MultipleSourceBooleanController(boolean isAndOperation)
        Create a new MultipleSourceBooleanController, either as an AND operation over its boolean set or an OR operation
        Parameters:
        isAndOperation - if an AND operation should be used. an OR operation is used otherwise. The constants AND and OR can be used for nicer-looking code.

    • Method Detail

      • getOutput

        public BooleanOutput getOutput(boolean dflt)
        Get one BooleanOutput that can be written to in order to update its element of the boolean set.
        Parameters:
        dflt - the default value before anything is written.
        Returns:
        the BooleanOutput that can be written to.

      • addInput

        public void addInput(BooleanInputPoll inp)
        Place the specified BooleanInput as an element in the boolean set. Since it is a polling boolean, its value will only be polled when another element changes.
        Parameters:
        inp - the boolean to include.

        Update the output from the current state.

      • addTarget

        public void addTarget(BooleanOutput output)
        Description copied from interface: BooleanInputProducer
        Subscribe to changes in this boolean input's value. The boolean output will be modified whenever the value of this input changes.
        Specified by:
        addTarget in interface BooleanInputProducer
        Parameters:
        output - The boolean output to notify when the value changes.
        See Also:
        BooleanOutput.writeValue(boolean), BooleanInputProducer.removeTarget(ccre.chan.BooleanOutput)

      • removeTarget

        public boolean removeTarget(BooleanOutput output)
        Description copied from interface: BooleanInputProducer
        Unsubscribe from changes in this boolean input's value. This reverses the actions of a previous addTarget call.
        Specified by:
        removeTarget in interface BooleanInputProducer
        Parameters:
        output - The output to unsubscribe.
        Returns:
        Whether the output was actually subscribed.
        See Also:
        BooleanInputProducer.addTarget(ccre.chan.BooleanOutput)
